page.title: 17Salmon Fishing Continued
page.content: Many of tyhe fisheries have now closed for various reasons, poaching both on the river and at sea have meant a reduction in the number of fish to be caught. The Tweed Commisioners,a body set up under The Tweed Act are responsible for trying to ensure the wellbeing of the river as a successful salmon fishing river and employ bailiffs to carry out the task of preventing poaching. The season starts on February 14th at midnight and ends at midight on September 14th the close season allows fish to travel upriver to the spawning beds.On the lower reaches the fishing is tidal but higher upriver most fishing is carried out in the hours of darkness except during floods when the water is coloured and they can work in daylight hours.Salmon,sea-trout and grilse are the fish netted.
